intro: Capitanopsis angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved capitan, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its narrow, linear leaves are arranged in a rosette pattern, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. Capitanopsis angustifolia is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops.
